channel.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India
channel.description: TOI delivers the Top Latest World news and Headlines from US, UK, Gulf, Pakistan, China, Europe and rest of the world.

image.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India

item.title: US House set to approve arms for Syrian rebels
item.description: The Republican-controlled House lined up half-heartedly to give the US military authority to train and arm Syrian rebels on Wednesday as President Barack Obama emphasized that American forces ''do not and will not have a combat mission'' in the struggle against Islamic state militants.

item.title: Toll in Nigeria building collapse hits 70
item.description: The incident occurred at the Synagogue Church of All Nations (SCOAN) Guest House in Ikotun downtown area of Lagos, which serves as a Mecca of sort to local people and foreigners from different parts of the world.

item.title: Bobby Jindal mulling US presidential run
item.description: Louisiana governor Bobby Jindal has for the first time acknowledged that he is considering a 2016 presidential run and will make a decision on it after the November Congressional polls.

item.title: France arrests 5 in militant women recruiting ring
item.description: France's top security official says five people have been arrested suspected of belonging to a ring that recruits young women to join Islamic militants in Syria.

item.title: Jihadists face growing pressure as US mulls strategy
item.description: Elite Iraqi troops backed by US jets battled jihadists near Baghdad on Wednesday as Washington devised a strategy for expanded operations against the Islamic State group.

item.title: Scotland’s first minister Salmond in major controversy
item.description: Alex Salmond, Scotland’s first minister, tried to force the principal of St Andrews University to criticize Westminster and tone down her warnings about the adverse impact if Scotland breaks away from the UK.

item.title: Alex Salmond forced St Andrews University principal over freedom concerns
item.description: Alex Salmond, Scotland’s first minister, tried to force the principal of St Andrews University to criticize Westminster and tone down her warnings about the adverse impact if Scotland breaks away from the UK.

item.title: Thai police hunt ‘prime suspect’ in murder of British pair
item.description: Myanmar migrants are frequently accused of committing crimes in the kingdom, where they make up a vast, poorly-paid and low-status workforce.

item.title: Bangladesh court commutes top Islamist's death sentence
item.description: Bangladesh's Supreme Court today commuted the death sentence of Delwar Hossain Sayedee, a top Islamist preacher whose sentencing last year triggered the deadliest political violence in the country's history, to life term.

item.title: Fiji stages first election since 2006 coup
item.description: Fijians voted today in the South Pacific nation's first election since a 2006 coup, with the military on standby in case violence flares but police reporting no problems in early polling.

item.title: US man accused of trying to aid Islamic State group
item.description: Elfgeeh was arrested earlier this year by members of the FBI's Rochester joint terrorism task force.

item.title: Racing wildfire engulfs homes in California town
item.description: In Weed, as crews put out remaining embers, residents wandered through scorched neighbourhoods covered in pink fire retardant had been dropped by firefighting airplanes.

item.title: US general is open to ground forces in fight against ISIS
item.description: General Dempsey acknowledged that this would run counter to the president’s policy, but he said, “He has told me as well to come back to him on a case-by-case basis.”

item.title: UN announces Israeli-Palestinian pact on rebuilding Gaza
item.description: The United Nations on Tuesday announced an agreement between Israel and the Palestinian Authority on the rebuilding of the Gaza Strip, devastated in the recent Israeli military offensive.

item.title: French parliament approves jihadist travel ban
item.description: France's parliament on Tuesday approved a new anti-terror bill aimed at preventing potential jihadists from travelling to Iraq, Syria or elsewhere by confiscating their passports.

item.title: Iran's current uranium enrichment not acceptable: US
item.description: Iran cannot convince the world that its current ability to enrich uranium is acceptable, the top US negotiator has said ahead of new nuclear talks with global powers.

item.title: US to fight its noblest war against Ebola
item.description: Pilloried for fighting needless, provocative wars across the world, the United States is embarking on one of its noblest interventions – fighting the Ebola outbreak in West Africa.

item.title: China to oppose India-Vietnam oil deal 'within its waters'
item.description: China on Tuesday made it clear that it will "not support" the India-Vietnam agreement to enable ONGC to explore two more oil wells if they fall within the waters of the disputed South China Sea administered by it.

item.title: Xi on maiden Sri Lanka visit to boost strategic, economic ties
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Tueday arrived in Sri Lanka on his maiden visit to cement strategic and economic ties with India's southern neighbour besides inking 20 key bilateral deals, including one for the construction of a US$ 1.4 billion port city.

item.title: Holy smoke: Vatican car seized with cocaine, cannabis
item.description: The Vatican was left red-faced after it emerged that a car bearing its diplomatic plates had been stopped in France with four kilogrammes of cocaine on board.

item.title: US strikes jihadists near Baghdad for first time
item.description: The United States has bombed militants near Baghdad in support of Iraqi forces, striking close to the capital for the first time in its expanded campaign against Islamic State jihadists.

item.title: Thai woman commits suicide by jumping into crocodile pond
item.description: A 65-year-old Thai woman has committed suicide by leaping into a pond of crocodiles at a farm popular with tourists on Bangkok's outskirts, police told AFP Tuesday.

item.title: Al-Qaida-inspired killers spreading like weeds
item.description: Osama bin Laden is dead and al-Qaida dispersed, yet the horrors keep coming.

item.title: James Foley's family felt lack of guidance by US
item.description: The email appeared in Michael Foley's inbox a year after his brother James disappeared on a reporting trip in northern Syria.

item.title: US denies claims that ISIS may enter through Mexico
item.description: Militants for the Islamic State have traveled to Mexico and are just miles from the United States.
